item.title: On Kepler's geometric approach to consonances
item.description: arXiv:2409.04119v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Kepler's thinking is highly original and the inspiration for discovering his famous third law is based on his rather curious geometric approach in his Harmonices mundi for explaining consonances. In this article we try to use a modern mathematical approach based on Kepler's ideas how to characterize the seven consonances with the help of the numbers of edges of polygons constructible by ruler and compass.
